Subject: Junk DNA and a recent biological study result...

X-Yahoo-Profile: jim_oflaherty_jr

Derek,

I thought you might like this article at New Scientist:
http://www.newscientist.com/news/news.jsp?id=ns99995063

I think this is pretty relevant to the "junk DNA" discussion in biology.

A relevant quote:
"He thinks it is pretty clear that these [DNA] sequences have no major role in growth and
development. "There has been a circular argument that if it's [DNA] conserved it has activity.""


Jim O'Flaherty, Jr.
